content: this is dmg and we're gonna make some pottery
okay so we're gonna make some hotter air for some shrubbery or something else in
the dungeon you know the things you're always smashing in all those computer
games where all the gold coins come out that's what we're making okay so these
are just little beads you've had like child type beads I pick these up in
dollar store for a buck they're not the highest quality but that doesn't matter
of the shapes the most important thing I'm gonna grab match stick and one of
the sequins that we used for the candelabra video that was only a couple
of videos ago so into the sequin which is gonna blob a hot glue and while
that's on the end of the hot glue gun we're just going to stick the match
stick in there to try to prevent wisps hopefully that will be the case in your
instance and that's what we're gonna have a sequin on a stick then we're
going to grab the bead on the bubble whatever you want to call it fill the
center with hot glue and push the match stick slowly through and not sticking
out the bottom so that match stick is about half the length of novel so you
probably have to cut it in half so it's about where2now centimeters one inch
long the length will really does is decided
by the type of bauble that you have and that length match sticks so then this is
the most interesting part you put a little bit of hot glue and rotate around
using the new bit of the hot glue gun without putting out more hot glue just
going to smooth the hot glue by rotating the entire piece and just getting it
shaped so that you've got it curved up to the sequin and straight down to the
bead at the bottom so that's going to give you the neck shape for this look
like a flower vase type of thing of being some sort of urn
or something like that so it'll stand okay on its own but we want to give it
more of base so we're going to get a little bit of cardstock cut out a small
probably one one inch diameter circle and there you go that's what it's going
to look like a little hot glue in the middle and just drop it on there so then
we get some red paint and mixing some yellow
this wasn't orange enough for me so I just blocked in some more yellow and mix
it up and then we're just applying it straight onto the piece I'd have not
black bombed it so when you choose the color of your bead that's why I went
with red you can choose anything really on the red spectrum and then this will
look okay which is like a green or a blue or some cooler color it may clash
with the orange what you may want to change the color to one of those colors
if you like so then I'm just using some Brown here mixing a little bit of the
yellow and the orange and I'm just going over the bottom of the urn to give it a
little bit of shadow and the same with the neck so don't do it on the top of
the curve just do it on the neck and you can do it also on the top there and then
I'm using straight brown just do a little little circle in the middle on
top where we're going to fake the hole down the neck and then we're going to
just apply black to the base to make it look like shadow and I'm just putting it
down here so I don't paint all over my fingers you can see it wobbling around
so you can just stick with something to hold that down and it does this does not
take very long at all and then it's just a blob of little black in the middle to
keep the illusion of that long deep neck happening and that's it
so that is pottery a little urn if you like this video I can by 10 check out
